===Malware and theft===
===Malware and theft===
â
A bitcoin account can be compromised if a wallet file is left unprotected. On June 13, 2011, a bitcoin user who goes by the forum handle 'allinvain' allegedly had his computer compromised and 25,000 bitcoins stolen worth roughly $467,000 [[USD]] at the time.<ref>http://forum.bitcoin.org/index.php?topic=16457.0</ref><ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/Cyber-Theft-Incident-Shows-the-Other-Side-of-the-Bitcoin-206205.shtml</ref><ref>http://www.pcworld.com/article/230377/worlds_first_virtual_heist_bitcoin_user_loses_500000.html</ref> The theft highlighted Malware designed specifically to steal BTC. <ref>[http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2011-06/17/bitcoin-malware]</ref>.
+
A bitcoin account can be compromised if a wallet file is left unprotected. On June 13, 2011, a bitcoin user who goes by the forum handle 'allinvain' allegedly had his computer compromised and 25,000 bitcoins stolen worth roughly $467,000 [[USD]] at the time.<ref>http://forum.bitcoin.org/index.php?topic=16457.0</ref><ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/Cyber-Theft-Incident-Shows-the-Other-Side-of-the-Bitcoin-206205.shtml</ref><ref>http://www.pcworld.com/article/230377/worlds_first_virtual_heist_bitcoin_user_loses_500000.html</ref> A few days later malware specificaly designed to steal bitcoin wallets was discovered.<ref>http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2011/06/bitcoin-malware/</ref><ref>http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/all-your-bitcoins-are-ours</ref><ref>http://www.symantec.com/security_response/writeup.jsp?docid=2011-061615-3651-99</ref><ref>http://www.f-secure.com/weblog/archives/00002187.html</ref>
